resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">

    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/103989</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>

  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770213040</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Volcanic Violence</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Vulkanische Gewalttätigkeit</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Violence Volcanique</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Violência Vulcânica</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Violenza Vulcanica</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ηφαιστειακή βία</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Violencia Volcánica</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Volcanoes are big movers and shakers in the business of continually redesigning the Earth's landscape. With no concern for nearby people or ecosystems, volcanoes release toxic gases, climate-altering ash, lava and rock. How does this work? Are scientists getting better at predicting volcanic eruptions? How do areas recover after destruction?</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Science and Technology</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Vulkane sind grosse Urheber und Schüttele-Apparat
im Geschäft von die Landschaft der Masse fortwährend neu entwerfen. 
Ohne Interesse für nahe gelegene Leute oder Oekosysteme geben 
Vulkane die giftigen Gase frei und Klima-ändern Asche, Lava und 
Felsen. Wie diese Arbeit? Sind die Wissenschaftler, die 
besser am Voraussagen vulkanische Eruptionen erhalten? Wie 
stellen Bereiche nach Zerstörung wieder her?</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Les volcans sont de grands moteurs et dispositifs 
trembleurs dans les affaires de remodeler continuellement l'horizontal
de la terre. Sans le souci pour les personnes voisines ou les 
écosystèmes, les volcans libèrent les gaz toxiques, 
climat-modifiant la cendre, la lave et la roche. Comment va-t-il
ce travail ? Les scientifiques atteignant mieux la prévision 
des éruptions sont-ils volcaniques ? Comment les zones 
récupèrent-elles après destruction ?</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Os vulcões são motores e shakers grandes no 
negócio continuamente de redesigning a paisagem da terra. Com 
nenhum interesse para povos próximos ou ecosystems, os vulcões 
liberam os gáses tóxicos, clima-alterando a cinza, a lava e a rocha.
Como  este trabalho? São os cientistas que começam mais 
melhor em predizer eruptions vulcânicos? Como as áreas 
recuperam após a destruição?</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">I vulcani sono motori ed agitatori grandi nel 
commercio continuamente di riprogettazione del paesaggio della terra. 
Senza preoccupazione per alla la gente vicina o gli ecosistemi, 
i vulcani liberano i gas tossici, clima-alteranti la cenere, la lava e
la roccia. Come questo lavoro? Sono gli scienziati che 
ottengono più meglio alla predizione eruptions vulcanici? Come 
le zone recuperano dopo distruzione?</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Τα ηφαίστεια είναι μεγάλοι μετακινούμενοι και δονητές
στην επιχείρηση συνεχώς να ξανασχεδιάσουν το γήινο τοπίο. 
Χωρίς την ανησυχία για τους κοντινούς ανθρώπους ή τα 
οικοσυστήματα, τα ηφαίστεια εκδίδουν τα τοξικά αέρια, την 
κλίμα-αλλάζοντας τέφρα, τη λάβα και το βράχο. Πώς αυτή η 
εργασία; Είναι οι επιστήμονες που παίρνουν καλύτερα στην 
πρόβλεψη ηφαιστειακές εκρήξεις; Πώς οι περιοχές ανακτούν 
μετά από την καταστροφή;</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Los volcanes son motores y coctelera grandes en el
negocio continuamente de reajustar el paisaje de la tierra. Sin 
la preocupación por la gente próxima o los ecosistemas, los volcanes
release/versión los gases tóxicos, clima-alterando la ceniza, la 
lava y la roca. ¿Cómo  este trabajo? ¿Son los 
científicos que consiguen mejor en predecir erupciones volcánicas? 
¿Cómo las áreas se recuperan después de la destrucción?</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Wissenschaft und Technologie</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">La Science et technologie</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Ciência e tecnologia</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Scienza e tecnologia</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Επιστήμη και τεχνολογία</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Ciencia y tecnología</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <lifeCycle>
          <contribute>
            <role>
              <source>roleValues</source>
              <value>author</value>
            </role>
            <entity>BEGIN:VCARD
N:DAVID TENENBAUM
FN:DAVID TENENBAUM
VERSION:3.0
END:VCARD</entity>
          </contribute>
        </lifeCycle>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770213040</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Custom License</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
